poem.title: gauze
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The gauze of language pulls away from empty settlements As gods on wooden horses cram the trunk road heading north Like too many leaf galls on a sprig of oak That Gauls and Philistines consider sawing off, although - Perhaps because - they're sitting on it, gobsmacked. Gingerly, one flicks the gongs in the music room, which whisper, And grogs in the hearth.
